vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
θᾰνᾰτ-όω,
future -ώσω[Refs 4th c.BC+], etc.: perfect τεθανάτωκα [Refs 1st c.BC+]:—passive, future -ωθήσομαι[LXX]: future middle in passivesense θανατώσοιτο [Refs 5th c.BC+]: aorist 1 ἐθανατώθην [Refs 5th c.BC+]: perfect τεθανάτωμαι [Refs 2nd c.BC+]:—put to death, τινα [Refs 5th c.BC+]; especially of the public executioner, [Refs 5th c.BC+] Phld.[same place]:— passive, to be made dead, [NT]; ὁ -ωθείς the murdered man, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 passive, of flesh, to be mortified, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—metaphorically in active, mortify, τὰς πράξεις τοῦ σώματος [NT]
__II condemn to death by sentence of law, [NT+5th c.BC+]:— passive, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; οἱ τεθανατωμένοι those condemned to death, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__III to be fatal, cause death, ὄφεις -οῦντες [LXX]; μυῖαι -οῦσαι[LXX+1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to put to death, kill
to put to death, deliver to death, Mt. 10:21; 26:59; Mk. 13:12; passive to be exposed to imminent danger of death, Rom. 8:36; in NT metaphorically to subdue, Rom. 8:13; passive to be dead to, to be rid, parted from, as if by the intervention of death, Rom. 7:4
vocabInfos._es_Definition: matar, entregar a muerte ; poner en peligro de muerte (ROM.8:36)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 治死
2) (使一個行動完全停止) 治死, 消滅 (羅 8:13)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 治死
2) (使一个行动完全停止) 治死, 消灭 (罗 8:13)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: giết chết; đưa đến cái chết
